data.title: Great fusion selections
data.text: This is my go to take out restaurant after work. The special rolls are out of this world. I think the sushi rolls are the best items on the menu.

data.title: Interesting Asian Fusion
data.text: On the recommendation of a local person we tried this restaurant and were not disappointed. Our group enjoyed everything from some rather unusual Japanese dishes one does not typically encounter in the United States (onigiri) to cashew chicken. Entrées came with a very good miso soup and a lovely ginger salad. The sushi and nigiri was fresh and delicious. The restaurant decor was very contemporary with this sort of odd electric blue quality to the lighting which made it difficult to see what the food actually looked like! But that was a minor caveat. Presentation was lovely with some of the plates decorated with the orchids.

data.title: Good place for sushi in South Bend
data.text: We came here for dinner on a Friday night of an ND home game.  Arrived a bit early (6:30) and were seated quickly and served efficiently.  We ordered lots of rolls and were very satisfied with all that arrived. Calamari appetizer was quite good.   Prices are a bit high but that is the cost of sushi.  I think you would like this place.

data.title: Really good Japanese and Chinese food
data.text: What a surprise to walk in this restaurant. It's big and has a lot to offer. A wide ranging menu that will not dissapoint

data.title: Very nice place for a college town
data.text: It is rewarding to find a high end place to eat something in a college town that is not fast food. The menu was very full of options  all of the ones we tasted were very very good. The place was clean, the service wonderful and full of people which gave it a nice atmosphere. The noise was perfect, neither too loud or to quiet.

data.title: Indiana Sushi, enough said
data.text: It's difficult to review restaurants sometimes when you have to keep telling yourself every 10 second to adjust your expectations based on your environment. The best sushi place in Indiana might be an average at best, place in NYC, so it is important to keep that in mind. Having said that, this place is "alright". It has generic rolls that taste OK, so it's unlikely you'll walk out with that "gross" feeling. If I rated this place in New York, it would be 1/5 rather than 2/5-3/5 but again, have to keep in mind where I am. I wouldn't recommend sushi/sashimi but some of the rolls are OK. Try the spicy red snapper roll.

data.title: awesome asian fusion food
data.text: very good and tasty asian fusion food, great size portions with a very relaxed and enjoyable atmosphere

data.title: Eat, Drink, South Bend
data.text: Love eating at this restaurant during restaurant week.  You get so much food for the money and its great food.

data.title: Decent sushi, contemporary atmosphere
data.text: My friend and I shared a couples platter and it was delicious and plenty to eat.  Super fresh and good variety of tuna and salmon

data.title: Great sushi great service
data.text: Went to visit son at Notre Dame with six family members- was hard to find a restaurant to meet all our different palates. Woochie fit the bill.  Great server who explained what the restaurant had to offer. Good deals at the time- $22 for three course meal. Had two appetitizers and the rainbow roll. Excellent food at a good price- will definitely eat there again.

data.title: Love this place
data.text: I love unique sushi rolls and WooChi knocks it out of the park!  My favorite is the "Beauty and the Beast". Hot, spicy and sweet. Love the ginger salad. Wish I could try everything.

data.title: Great sushi
data.text: We ordered nine rolls for eight people to share and we finished them all: Apollo, Angel hair, OMG wasabi, Volcano, Mango Madness, Godzilla, Rock & Roll, Lady Gar-Gar, and Philadelphia roll. We throughly enjoyed each roll!!! This was our second visit in two weeks and we have to drive 40-45 minutes to get there but well worth the drive.

data.title: Good food but not great
data.text: The sushi is good but the hibachi meals do not have enough vegetables. Just a small bowl on the side. The service is okay but could be better. The music is sometimes a bit much at dinner. More like club music even in the dining area.

data.title: Excellent dining experience
data.text:
The presentation and atmosphere were well done. Surprisingly varied and tasteful menu. 

All the members of my party commented on the quality of their seafood. Scallops were the best I had had other than Boston / Long Island. 

Tea selection is novel and complements the menu well. 

Good service as well.

data.title: Great service and food at a reasonable price
data.text: We went here before a concert at the Morris. The hostess seated us right away and by a window as requested. There are multiple areas to sit each with its own ambiance - family friendly, romantic and then a bar area. They have top shelf spirits and a wide variety of food - Japanese, Chinese and Thai. Quick service and good food.

data.title: Great after work cocktails, food fine
data.text: I came here for business and came here to have dinner.  The drink menu is fabulous - lots of interesting things to choose from.  The dinner menu is extensive, sushi and asian fusion offerings.  Nothing we ate was memorable - it was just food to satisfy hunger. The service was very good.

data.title: Outstanding!
data.text: Met an old friend there for dinner.  Beautiful decor, wonderful food, excellent service. Extensive menu.  We didn't have sushi, but the hibachi entrees, appetizers and noodle entree were DELICIOUS!  Definitely would go there again.

data.title: Slightly above average food. Poor service.
data.text: Food is nicely plated but only slightly above average. My ginger salad was excellent but my kung pao chicken had only tiny bits of what didn't seem like the chicken breast advertised in the menu. Why skimp on the chicken breast? For $13 I think the restaurant can afford to serve an actual chicken breast. The service was pretty poor for what I'd consider a nicer restaurant. Our server was slow and inattentive. However, the real shocker was that one of hosts behind the front desk was wearing a rather aggressive political T-shirt, which I thought was very distasteful, unprofessional, and inappropriate. Is this restaurant trying to send a message that the only patrons wanted are those who politically agree with staff members? Very odd.

data.title: Lori Voorde-Morss
data.text: Very very disappointed. 3rd time I was there with my family. Friday night and they told us ten mins to wait for table it was 45. After finally getting a table..all the orders came out in sporadic times ( there were 5 of us) my daughter's sushi order was wrong and it just seemed to me they were not prepared for the crowd on a first Friday in Downtown South Bend restaurant promotion. Love the food but may not go back. Guy at the front door handing waiting customers was horrible too!! Did NOT greet anybody and gave them random wait times!! Soooo disappointed 👎🏻☹️😡

data.title: Tasty and large portions
data.text: My visits to South Bend almost always includes a visit to Woochi. I have never had a bad mealor service. You won't go away hungry either.
